4FP.F.summary: Grupo Famsa, S.A.B. de C.V., through its subsidiaries, operates in the wholesale and retail of consumer products in Mexico and the United States. It sells furniture, appliances, electronics, clothing and footwear, and other products. The company is also involved in banking operation, including the provision of deposit and loan products, as well as provides financing services. It operates a network of 379 retail stores in Mexico; and 22 retail stores in Texas and Illinois. Grupo Famsa, S.A.B. de C.V. was founded in 1970 and is based in Monterrey, Mexico.

4FU.F.summary: Alsea, S.A.B. de C.V., together with its subsidiaries, operates quick service, coffee shop, casual dining, and family dining restaurants. Its brand portfolio includes Domino's Pizza, Starbucks, Burger King, Chili's Grill & Bar, California Pizza Kitchen, P.F. Chang's, Italianni's, The Cheese Cake Factory, Vips, La Finca, El PortÃ³n, Archies, P.F, Chang's, Foster's Hollywood, CaÃ±as and Tapas, Il Tempietto, La Vaca Argentina, VIPS, VIPS Smart, GINOS, Fridays, and Wagamama brands. The company also engages in factoring and financial leasing activities. It operates 3,688 units, including 1,805 quick services restaurants; 1,024 coffee shops; 573 casual dinning restaurants; and 286 family restaurants in Mexico, Spain, Argentina, Colombia, Chile, Brazil, and Uruguay. The company was incorporated in 1997 and is headquartered in Mexico City, Mexico.

4GJ.F.long_name: Consorcio ARA, S. A. B. de C. V.
4GJ.F.summary: Consorcio ARA, S. A. B. de C. V., together with its subsidiaries, designs, develops, builds, and sells entry-level and middle-income residential housing developments in Mexico. The company also develops and leases shopping malls and commercial premises. As of December 31, 2019, it had a land bank of approximately 32.7 million square meters, as well as operated 6 shopping centers, unicenters, and minicenters. The company was founded in 1977 and is based in Mexico City, Mexico.

4GP.F.long_name: Urbi, Desarrollos Urbanos, S.A.B. de C.V.
4GP.F.summary: Urbi, Desarrollos Urbanos, S.A.B. de C.V. engages in the housing development business in Mexico. It develops housing properties aimed at lower income population. The company was founded in 1981 and is based in Mexicali, Mexico.

The company was incorporated in 1997 and is headquartered in Mexico City, Mexico.

ARA.MX.long_name: Consorcio ARA, S. A. B. de C. V.
ARA.MX.summary: Consorcio ARA, S. A. B. de C. V., together with its subsidiaries, designs, develops, builds, and sells entry-level and middle-income residential housing developments in Mexico. The company also develops and leases shopping malls and commercial premises. As of December 31, 2019, it had a land bank of approximately 32.7 million square meters, as well as operated 6 shopping centers, unicenters, and minicenters. The company was founded in 1977 and is based in Mexico City, Mexico.

BWMX.long_name: Betterware de Mexico, S.A.B. de C.V.
BWMX.summary: Betterware de Mexico, S.A.B. de C.V. operates as a direct-to-consumer company in Mexico. The company focuses on the home organization segment with a product portfolio, including home organization, kitchen preparation, food containers, technology and mobility, and others. It serves approximately 3 million households through distributors and associates in approximately 800 communities throughout Mexico. The company was formerly known as Betterware de MÃ©xico, S.A.P.I. de C.V. Betterware de Mexico, S.A.B. de C.V. was founded in 1995 and is based in Zapopan, Mexico. Betterware de Mexico, S.A.B. de C.V. is a subsidiary of Invex Security Trust 2397.

CIDMEGA.MX.summary: Grupe, S.A.B. de C.V. operates in the hospitality sector in Mexico. The company operates hotels, resorts, golf courses, country clubs, and marinas. It also develops real estate properties. The company was founded in 1972 and is based in MazatlÃ¡n, Mexico.

CIEB.MX.short_name: CORP INTERAMERI ENTRET SAB DE C
CIEB.MX.long_name: Corporación Interamericana de Entretenimiento, S.A.B. de C.V.
CIEB.MX.summary: CorporaciÃ³n Interamericana de Entretenimiento, S.A.B. de C.V. operates in the entertainment industry worldwide. The company produces and organizes out-of-home entertainment events, including concerts, theater productions, sporting events, family and cultural events, and others. It also promotes and markets the Mexico F1 Grand Prix. In addition, the company produces and organizes special and corporate events; and operates the Citibanamex Center, an exposition and convention center in Mexico City. Further, it operates El Salitre, an amusement park in BogotÃ¡, Colombia. The company was founded in 1990 and is based in Mexico City, Mexico.

CMRB.MX.summary: CMR, S.A.B. de C.V. operates restaurants in Mexico. It operates restaurants under the Wings, Chili's, Olive Garden, La DestilerÃ­a, EL LAGO, Red Lobster, THE CAPITAL GRILLE, Fly by WINGS, NESCAFE, MUCHO, and SALA GASTRONOMICA brands. The company was formerly known as CorporaciÃ³n Mexicana de Restaurantes, S.A. de C.V. and changed its name to CMR, S.A.B. de C.V. in April 2006. CMR, S.A.B. de C.V. was founded in 1965 and is based in Mexico City, Mexico.

CONVERA.MX.summary: Convertidora Industrial, S.A.B. de C.V. engages in the production and conversion of plastic films for use as flexible packaging for industrial, food, and party item applications in Mexico and internationally. The company provides flexible packaging products, including plastic bags, plastic packaging films, laminations, five-layer co-extrusions, wickets, pouches, standing pouches, zipper and courier bags, etc., as well as balloons, banners, printed tablecloths, door banners, and printed titeres. Convertidora Industrial, S.A.B. de C.V. is based in Guadalajara, Mexico.

GFAMSAA.MX.summary: Grupo Famsa, S.A.B. de C.V., through its subsidiaries, operates in the wholesale and retail of consumer products in Mexico and the United States. It sells furniture, appliances, electronics, clothing and footwear, and other products. The company is also involved in banking operation, including the provision of deposit and loan products, as well as provides financing services. It operates a network of 379 retail stores in Mexico; and 22 retail stores in Texas and Illinois. Grupo Famsa, S.A.B. de C.V. was founded in 1970 and is based in Monterrey, Mexico.

GIGANTE.MX.long_name: Grupo Gigante, S. A. B. de C. V.
GIGANTE.MX.summary: Grupo Gigante, S. A. B. de C. V., together with its subsidiaries, operates self-service stores that sell office supplies, electronic goods, and housewares in Mexico, Central America, the Caribbean, Colombia, and Chile. The company operates through Retail, Prisa Distribution, Restaurants, Real Estate, and Other segments. It also engages in the management and development of investment property, retail stores, shopping malls, and corporate office buildings; and operation of restaurants. In addition, the company engages in parking lot operations; and information technology consulting and technical support activities. As of December 31, 2019, the company operated 302 office supply stores; 195 electronics and technology stores; 20 self-service stores; 218 restaurants, including 211 restaurants under the Restaurantes Toks brand and 7 restaurants Beer Factory units; 23 Chinese fast food restaurants through franchise agreement; and 2 fast food restaurants under the Shake Shack brand through a franchise agreement. Grupo Gigante, S. A. B. de C. V. was founded in 1962 and is headquartered in Mexico City, Mexico.

GISSAA.MX.long_name: Grupo Industrial Saltillo, S.A.B. de C.V.
GISSAA.MX.summary: Grupo Industrial Saltillo, S.A.B. de C.V. designs, manufactures, and markets various products for auto parts, construction, and housewares sectors primarily in North America, Europe, and Asia. The company manufactures and markets aluminum castings and machining parts, as well as gray and ductile iron auto parts for brakes, chassis systems, powertrain, engines, and transmission and suspension systems for the automotive and commercial vehicle industries. It offers auto parts under the Draxton, Evercast, GISederlan brands. The company also produces and markets ceramic and porcelain tiles and wall coverings under the Vitromex, Arko, and Construpiso brands. In addition, it manufactures and markets kitchenware and tableware products, as well as trades a range of countertop kitchen appliances, such as blenders and cookers primarily under the Cinsa and Santa Anita brand names. Grupo Industrial Saltillo, S.A.B. de C.V. was founded in 1928 and is based in Saltillo, Mexico.

GPH1.MX.short_name: GRUPO PALACIO DE HIERRO SAB DE
GPH1.MX.long_name: Grupo Palacio de Hierro, S.A.B. de C.V.
GPH1.MX.summary: Grupo Palacio de Hierro, S.A.B. de C.V. engages in the operation of department stores in Mexico. Its stores offers luxury, boutique, fashion, perfumery, home, and technology products. The company also engages in restaurant and logistic businesses. Grupo Palacio de Hierro, S.A.B. de C.V. was founded in 1888 and is based in Mexico City, Mexico.

GSANBORB-1.MX.summary: Grupo Sanborns, S.A.B. de C.V. operates retail stores and restaurants in Mexico and Central America. The company operates department stores, specialty stores, electronics and entertainment stores, convenience stores, luxury stores, and restaurants, as well as boutique stores. Its stores offer fashion ware, large and small appliances, furniture, home improvement products and electronics, books, magazines, health and beauty products, pharmacy products, toys, music and video products, jewelry, photography products, cellular phones, candies, gifts, Apple products and accessories, movies, video games, cosmetics and perfumes, food products, and clothing and accessories. The company also operates shopping malls and an e-commerce platform. As of December 31, 2019, it operated 98 stores under the Sears brand; 164 stores under the Sanborns brand; 136 stores under the iShop and MixUp brands; 22 stores under the Sanborns CafÃ© brand; 25 stores under the Dax brand; and two stores under the Saks Fifth Avenue brand. The company was incorporated in 1928 and is headquartered in Mexico City, Mexico. Grupo Sanborns, S.A.B. de C.V. is a subsidiary of Grupo Carso, S.A.B. de C.V.

HCITY.MX.short_name: HOTELES CITY EXPRESS SAB DE CV
HCITY.MX.long_name: Hoteles City Express, S.A.B. de C.V.
HCITY.MX.summary: Hoteles City Express, S.A.B. de C.V. operates and franchises a chain of limited-service hotels in Mexico, Costa Rica, Colombia, and Chile. As of December 31, 2020, it operated 154 hotels under the City Express, City Express Plus, City Express Suites, City Express Junior, and City Centro brands. The company also leases commercial space for rent. It primarily serves business travelers. The company was founded in 2002 and is based in Mexico City, Mexico.

HOMEX.MX.summary: Desarrolladora Homex, S.A.B. de C.V., develops homes in Mexico. The company was founded in 1989 and is headquartered in CuliacÃ¡n, Mexico.

HOTEL.MX.short_name: GRUPO HOTELERO SANTA FE SAB DE
HOTEL.MX.long_name: Grupo Hotelero Santa Fe, S.A.B. de C.V.
HOTEL.MX.summary: Grupo Hotelero Santa Fe, S.A.B. de C.V. acquires, develops, and operates city and beach hotels in Mexico. It operates in three segments: Urban Services, Resort Services, and Operator and Holding. The company operates a portfolio of hotels under owned brands, such as Krystal Resorts, Krystal Grand, Krystal Beach, and Krystal Urban; and franchises licensed brands, including Hilton, Hyatt, Marriott and Accor, and others, as well as operates third party hotels. It operates hotels in the 4 stars, 5 stars, and Gran Tourism markets. The company has a strategic alliance with AMResorts and private investors to develop the Breathless Tulum Resort & Spa, a tourism category resort. Grupo Hotelero Santa Fe, S.A.B. de C.V. is based in Mexico City, Mexico.

JAVER.MX.long_name: Servicios Corporativos Javer, S.A.B. de C.V.
JAVER.MX.summary: Servicios Corporativos Javer, S.A.B. de C.V., together with its subsidiaries, operates as a housing developer in Mexico. The company engages in the construction and sale of social, middle income, and residential housings. It operates in the states of Nuevo Leon, Jalisco, QuerÃ©taro, Aguascalientes, Tamaulipas, and Quintana Roo, as well as in State of Mexico. The company was founded in 1973 and is headquartered in Monterrey, Mexico.

LACOMERUBC.MX.summary: La Comer, S.A.B. de C.V., together with its subsidiaries, operates supermarkets in Mexico. Its supermarkets offer fruits and vegetables, meats and birds, prepared foods, pharmacy, wines and liquors, and hygiene and beauty products. As of December 31, 2019, the company operated 71 stores under the City Market, Fresko, La Comer, and Sumesa formats. It also sells its products online though La Comer en tu Casa, a digital platform. In addition, the company leases real estate contracts on stores; and transportation equipment. La Comer, S.A.B. de C.V. was founded in 1930 and is based in Mexico City, Mexico.

LIVEPOL1.MX.short_name: EL PUERTO DE LIVERPOOL SAB DE C
LIVEPOL1.MX.long_name: El Puerto de Liverpool, S.A.B. de C.V.
LIVEPOL1.MX.summary: El Puerto de Liverpool, S. A. B. de C. V., together with its subsidiaries, operates a chain of department stores in Mexico. The company operates through Liverpool Commercial, Suburbia Commercial, and Real Estate segments. Its stores offer various products, such as clothes and accessories for men, women, and children; household goods; furniture; cosmetics; and other consumer products. As of December 31, 2020, it operated 122 department stores under the Liverpool name; 124 specialized boutiques; and 165 stores under the Suburbia name. The company is also involved in the operation of liverpool.com.mx and suburbia.com.mx websites. In addition, it owns and leases 28 shopping malls under the GalerÃ­as name; and provides credit cards under the Liverpool and Liverpool Premium Card name, as well as Suburbia and Suburbia VISA credit cards. Further, the company operates boutiques under the Banana Republic, GAP, Pottery Barn, West Elm, and Williams-Sonoma names. El Puerto de Liverpool, S. A. B. de C. V. as founded in 1847 and is headquartered in Mexico City, Mexico.

LIVEPOLC-1.MX.short_name: EL PUERTO DE LIVERPOOL SAB DE C
LIVEPOLC-1.MX.long_name: El Puerto de Liverpool, S.A.B. de C.V.
LIVEPOLC-1.MX.summary: El Puerto de Liverpool, S. A. B. de C. V., together with its subsidiaries, operates a chain of department stores in Mexico. The company operates through Liverpool Commercial, Suburbia Commercial, and Real Estate segments. Its stores offer various products, such as clothes and accessories for men, women, and children; household goods; furniture; cosmetics; and other consumer products. As of December 31, 2020, it operated 122 department stores under the Liverpool name; 124 specialized boutiques; and 165 stores under the Suburbia name. The company is also involved in the operation of liverpool.com.mx and suburbia.com.mx websites. V. as founded in 1847 and is headquartered in Mexico City, Mexico.

NEMAKA.MX.long_name: Nemak, S. A. B. de C. V.
NEMAKA.MX.summary: Nemak, S. A. B. de C. V., together with its subsidiaries, develops, manufactures, and sells aluminum components for powertrain, e-mobility, and structural applications to the automotive industry in North America, Europe, and internationally. It offers powertrain components, such as cylinder heads, engine blocks, and transmission cases; vehicle structures, including longitudinal members, shock towers, and subframes; and e-mobility components comprising e-motor and battery housings. The company was formerly known as Tenedora Nemak, S. A. de C. V. and changed its name to Nemak, S. A. B. de C. V. in June 2015. Nemak, S. A. B. de C. V. was incorporated in 1979 and is headquartered in Garcia, Mexico. As of October 05, 2020, Nemak, S. A. B. de C. V. as a subsidiary of Controladora Nemak, S. A. B. de C. V.

OSOB.F.long_name: Organización Soriana, S. A. B. de C. V.
OSOB.F.summary: OrganizaciÃ³n Soriana, S. A. B. de C. V., together with its subsidiaries, operates various formats of supermarket stores in Mexico. The company's supermarket stores offer various food, clothing, general merchandise, health products, and basic household services, as well as grocery products and perishable goods under the retail, medium wholesale, and wholesale schemes. As of December 31, 2019, it operated 810 stores, which included 380 Hyper, 165 Markets, 127 Super, 103 Express, and 35 City Club. The company also operates 107 convenience stores under the Super City name by own stores and franchises; and Soriana.com, an online store. In addition, it leases commercial premises to each store as part of the commercial area; and conducts commercial developments. The company was founded in 1968 and is headquartered in Monterrey, Mexico.

POSADASA.MX.summary: Grupo Posadas, S.A.B. de C.V. owns, operates, and manages hotels primarily in Mexico. The company operates hotels primarily under the Live Aqua, Grand Fiesta Americana, Fiesta Americana, The Explorean, Fiesta Inn, One Hotels, and Gamma brand names. It also operates Fiesta Americana Vacation Club that sells vacation club memberships, as well as purchases and sells real estate properties in the tourism industry. As of December 30, 2019, the company operated 184 hotels with approximately 29, 851 rooms. Grupo Posadas, S.A.B. de C.V. was founded in 1967 and is based in Mexico City, Mexico.

SORIANAB.MX.long_name: Organización Soriana, S. A. B. de C. V.
SORIANAB.MX.summary: OrganizaciÃ³n Soriana, S. A. B. de C. V., together with its subsidiaries, operates various formats of supermarket stores in Mexico. The company's supermarket stores offer various food, clothing, general merchandise, health products, and basic household services, as well as grocery products and perishable goods under the retail, medium wholesale, and wholesale schemes. As of December 31, 2019, it operated 810 stores, which included 380 Hyper, 165 Markets, 127 Super, 103 Express, and 35 City Club. The company also operates 107 convenience stores under the Super City name by own stores and franchises; and Soriana.com, an online store. In addition, it leases commercial premises to each store as part of the commercial area; and conducts commercial developments. The company was founded in 1968 and is headquartered in Monterrey, Mexico.

SPORTS.MX.short_name: GRUPO SPORTS WORLD SAB DE CV
SPORTS.MX.long_name: Grupo Sports World, S.A.B. de C.V.
SPORTS.MX.summary: Grupo Sports World, S.A.B. de C.V. operates family fitness clubs in Mexico. The company offers a range of sports activities and programs, as well as training, health, and nutrition services. As of December 31, 2017, it operated 57 clubs in Tijuana, Luna Parc, Arboledas, and Coacoalco. Grupo Sports World, S.A.B. de C.V. was founded in 1989 and is based in Mexico City, Mexico.

URBI.MX.long_name: Urbi, Desarrollos Urbanos, S.A.B. de C.V.
URBI.MX.summary: Urbi, Desarrollos Urbanos, S.A.B. de C.V. engages in the housing development business in Mexico. It develops housing properties aimed at lower income population. The company was founded in 1981 and is based in Mexicali, Mexico.

VASCONI.MX.summary: Grupo Vasconia, S.A.B. provides industrial and consumer products in Mexico. It operates through two divisions, Industrial Products and Consumer Products. The Industrial Products division produces flat aluminum products, including rolls, sheets, tapes, and plates; natural and painted discs; aluminum foils for industrial and domestic use; and trays and finstock products under the Almexa, Imasa, Alupak, Alurey, and Aluchef brands for distributors and producers of aluminum items. The Consumer Products division develops, manufactures, and markets articles, such as Pots Express pans and grills, cookware, utensils and auxiliaries, pastry molds, knives and chopping boards, crockery and cutlery, airtight and thermos, kitchen accessories, products for bar and barbecue, professional line, etc. This division distributes its products to departmental stores, self-service stores, price clubs, wholesalers, government, furniture stores, specialized and own stores, catalog sales, and factory outlets. It also exports its products to the United States, and Central and South America. The company was formerly known as Ekco, S.A.B. and changed its name to Grupo Vasconia, S.A.B. in 2008. Grupo Vasconia, S.A.B. was founded in 1911 and is based in CuautitlÃ¡n, Mexico.
